blocks.title: When It Comes To Personas, The Real Value Is In The Scenarios
blocks.generated_title: When It Comes To Personas, The Real Value Is In The Scenarios
blocks.description_html: Personas without scenarios are like characters with no plot. - Kim Goodwin I've seen it happen many times. A team launches a project to identify user personas with all the best of intentions. They'll define three, four, sometimes as many ten or fifteen different personas.
blocks.description: Personas without scenarios are like characters with no plot. - Kim Goodwin I've seen it happen many times. A team launches a project to identify user personas with all the best of intentions. They'll define three, four, sometimes as many ten or fifteen different personas.

source.title: When It Comes To Personas, The Real Value Is In The Scenarios

blocks.title: UX Flows, and Why They're So Confusing
blocks.generated_title: UX Flows, and Why They're So Confusing
blocks.description_html: Flow-chart The flow-chart is relatively straight-forward, at least in terms of its definition. Flow-charts are useful for mapping out the possibilities that may entail a product's full experience, or a subsection of it. Flow-charts are often easily identifiable because they tend to use UML (Unified Modeling Language), in which ovals denote the beginning and end of a process, and diamonds denote decisions, etc.
blocks.description: Flow-chart The flow-chart is relatively straight-forward, at least in terms of its definition. Flow-charts are useful for mapping out the possibilities that may entail a product's full experience, or a subsection of it. Flow-charts are often easily identifiable because they tend to use UML (Unified Modeling Language), in which ovals denote the beginning and end of a process, and diamonds denote decisions, etc.

source.title: UX Flows, and Why They're So Confusing

blocks.title: Creating Excellent UX Flow Charts
blocks.description_html: Flow charts remain my favorite artifact in the design process. With increasingly complex apps, flow charts help to model fluid, conversational experiences. To that end, they answer two essential questions: When do we show specific bits of information? How do we respond to a user behavior?
blocks.description: Flow charts remain my favorite artifact in the design process. With increasingly complex apps, flow charts help to model fluid, conversational experiences. To that end, they answer two essential questions: When do we show specific bits of information? How do we respond to a user behavior?

source.title: Creating Excellent UX Flow Charts

blocks.title: Teach Slower to Teach Better.
blocks.description_html: Over the last decade, as a rejection to a tired model of higher education, new educational programs and structures have emerged. Many of these are in the fields of design, digital product development, and programming. The new models of education take many forms. Some are short day-long or week-long workshops.
blocks.description: Over the last decade, as a rejection to a tired model of higher education, new educational programs and structures have emerged. Many of these are in the fields of design, digital product development, and programming. The new models of education take many forms. Some are short day-long or week-long workshops.

source.title: Teach Slower to Teach Better.

blocks.title: The Analysis-Synthesis Bridge Model
blocks.description_html: The simplest way to describe the design process is to divide it into two phases: analysis and synthesis. Or preparation and inspiration. But those descriptions miss a crucial element-the connection between the two, the active move from one state to another, the transition or transformation that is at the heart of designing.
blocks.description: The simplest way to describe the design process is to divide it into two phases: analysis and synthesis. Or preparation and inspiration. But those descriptions miss a crucial element-the connection between the two, the active move from one state to another, the transition or transformation that is at the heart of designing.

source.title: The Analysis-Synthesis Bridge Model

blocks.title: An Introduction to Interaction Flows
blocks.description_html: Could IX Flows be a key to smoother design/dev handoffs? As UX Designers, we put care and critical thought in our projects. Every interaction is planted with a specific purpose for the user. This is why it makes it that much more painful for us when the final developed interface does not align with our original vision.
blocks.description: Could IX Flows be a key to smoother design/dev handoffs? As UX Designers, we put care and critical thought in our projects. Every interaction is planted with a specific purpose for the user. This is why it makes it that much more painful for us when the final developed interface does not align with our original vision.

source.title: An Introduction to Interaction Flows

blocks.title: A shorthand for designing UI flows
blocks.generated_title: A shorthand for designing UI flows
blocks.description_html: Flows are just as important to good interfaces as individual screens are. Customers don't land on screens from out of nowhere. Specific sequences of actions lead customers through your app as they try to accomplish their tasks. But as important as they are, flows are hard to communicate du...

blocks.title: Object-Oriented UX, Part 1 | Think Company
blocks.description_html: In the physical world, like in a drugstore or a supermarket, I have been trained to expect certain wayfinding points. Look up for aisle signs-they serve as broad menu items, mimicking that of a universal navigation within an interface. There are lane numbers with broad categorizations.

Look up for aisle signs-they serve as broad menu items, mimicking that of a universal navigation within an interface. There are lane numbers with broad categorizations.

blocks.title: Information Architecture Lenses
blocks.description_html: Information architecture is the practice of designing the virtual structures that underpin digital products. I'm continually impressed with how fundamental and difficult this work is. With digital products becoming more complex and specialized, information architecture remains as essential as ever. These structures demand deliberate and vigorous attention.
blocks.description: Information architecture is the practice of designing the virtual structures that underpin digital products. I'm continually impressed with how fundamental and difficult this work is. With digital products becoming more complex and specialized, information architecture remains as essential as ever. These structures demand deliberate and vigorous attention.

source.title: Information Architecture Lenses

blocks.title: Goal-Directed Design
blocks.description_html:
Goal-Directed Design combines techniques of ethnography, stakeholder interviews, market research, detailed user models, scenario-based design, and a core set of interaction principles and patterns. It provides solutions that meet users’ needs and goals while also addressing business/organizational and technical imperatives.

http://www.dubberly.com/articles/alan-cooper-and-the-goal-directed-design-process.html
blocks.description:

blocks.title: A Unified Theory for Designing Just About Anything
blocks.generated_title: A Unified Theory for Designing Just About Anything

How could Amazon be so good at Information Architecture & Interaction Design, and yet so bad at Graphic Design (and Apple software the opposite: pretty and pretty unusable.)
blocks.description: A few years back I was obsessed with the question of why some companies rocked at one thing, and sucked at another.
